headline: Netflix Offers Mostly Cash for Warner Bros. in New Bid Round
summary: Bankers for Paramount Skydance Corp., Comcast Corp. and Netflix worked over the long Thanksgiving weekend on improved offers for all or part of Warner Bros., said the people, who asked not to be identified discussing nonpublic information.  Paramount’s offer, while largely backed by the family of Oracle Corp. co-founder Larry Ellison, includes debt financing from Apollo Global Management Inc. Middle East funds are also contributing, the people said.  Netflix, the streaming industry leader, is working on a bridge loan that totals tens of billions of dollars, one of the people said.

content.title: Netflix Offers Mostly Cash for Warner Bros. in New Bid Round
content.summary: Bankers for Paramount Skydance Corp., Comcast Corp. and Netflix worked over the long Thanksgiving weekend on improved offers for all or part of Warner Bros., said the people, who asked not to be identified discussing nonpublic information.  Paramount’s offer, while largely backed by the family of Oracle Corp. co-founder Larry Ellison, includes debt financing from Apollo Global Management Inc. Middle East funds are also contributing, the people said.  Netflix, the streaming industry leader, is working on a bridge loan that totals tens of billions of dollars, one of the people said.

headline: Baird Maintains Positive Outlook on Oracle (ORCL)
summary: Oracle Corporation (NYSE:ORCL) is one of the best dividend stocks to buy according to hedge funds. On November 18, Baird maintained an Outperform rating on ORCL but slashed the target price from $365 to $315. The firm altered its bullish sentiment after observing Oracle’s debt and AI capacity. headline: Did Oracle's (ORCL) Debt-Fueled AI Expansion and New Board Member Just Shift Its Investment Narrative?
summary: In recent weeks, Oracle announced it unanimously elected former Quest Diagnostics CEO Stephen Rusckowski to its board, while Orca Security revealed its Cloud Native Application Protection Platform is now available in Oracle Cloud Marketplace for deployment on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. This period also saw market and analyst focus shift toward Oracle's substantial increase in debt to fund AI data center expansion, prompting debate over its financial risk and reliance on large-scale OpenAI...

headline: Oracle Stock Punished Further By OpenAI Fears As Analysts Offer Opposing Takes
summary: Oracle stock is coming off a brutal month, with shares sliding more than 20% in November and slipping further on the first trading day in December.  The top debate about Oracle has been its huge cloud deals with ChatGPT creator OpenAI — with analysts offering recent bullish and bearish views.  Oracle stock surged in September after the company revealed that its remaining performance obligations surged 359% to $455 billion during its August-ended quarter.

content.title: Oracle Stock Punished Further By OpenAI Fears As Analysts Offer Opposing Takes

The top debate about Oracle has been its huge cloud deals with ChatGPT creator OpenAI — with analysts offering recent bullish and bearish views.  Oracle stock surged in September after the company revealed that its remaining performance obligations surged 359% to $455 billion during its August-ended quarter.

headline: Oracle Sets the Date for its Second Quarter Fiscal Year 2026 Earnings Announcement
summary: Oracle Corporation today announced that its second quarter fiscal year 2026 results will be released on Wednesday, December 10th, after the close of the market. Oracle will host a conference call and live webcast at 4:00 p.m. Central Time to discuss the financial results. The live webcast will be available on the Oracle Investor Relations website at www.oracle.com/investor.

content.title: Oracle Sets the Date for its Second Quarter Fiscal Year 2026 Earnings Announcement
content.summary: Oracle Corporation today announced that its second quarter fiscal year 2026 results will be released on Wednesday, December 10th, after the close of the market. Oracle will host a conference call and live webcast at 4:00 p.m. Central Time to discuss the financial results. The live webcast will be available on the Oracle Investor Relations website at www.oracle.com/investor.

headline: 2 AI Darlings Everyone Loves Today — And Will Panic-Sell Tomorrow
summary: The AI boom has become the single brightest spot in an otherwise sluggish global economy. Hyperscalers are spending upwards of $400 billion this year alone on data centers, and investors are desperate to own any piece of that growth. Two names have ridden the wave especially hard: Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) and Digital Realty Trust (NYSE:DLR). Oracle ... 2 AI Darlings Everyone Loves Today — And Will Panic-Sell Tomorrow

headline: Netflix Makes a Fresh Warner Discovery Bid, Report Says. This Could Derail the Deal.
summary: The bidding war for  Warner Bros. Discovery  is heating up—but CBS parent  Paramount Skydance  still looks best-placed to see off video streamer  Netflix  and win the takeover battle.  Netflix on Monday made a primarily cash-based second offer for Warner Discovery’s entertainment and studios businesses, The Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter.  Netflix is working to secure tens of billions in financing to fund the deal, per the report.

content.title: Netflix Makes a Fresh Warner Discovery Bid, Report Says. This Could Derail the Deal.

Netflix is working to secure tens of billions in financing to fund the deal, per the report.

headline: Warner Bros. Rises As Bids Take Shape, Netflix Makes New Cash Offer
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) received a second round of offers from Netflix (NFLX), Comcast (CMCSA), and Paramount Skydance (PSKY), Bloomberg reported on Tuesday. The three suitors are all vying to buy all or part of Warner Bros., which put itself up for sale in October. Warner had set a Dec. 1 deadline for this most recent batch of bids. The...

headline: Azul Platform Core Enables Ausgrid to Eliminate Oracle Java Audit Risk and Cut License Costs by 80%
summary: SUNNYVALE, Calif., December 02, 2025--Azul, the only company 100% focused on Java, today announced that Ausgrid, Australia’s largest electricity distributor, has eliminated Oracle Java audit exposure and reduced potential Java licensing costs by 80% after migrating to Azul Platform Core. The migration, completed in just two months, also reduced Java-related vulnerabilities by 99% across Ausgrid’s IT environment.

content.title: Azul Platform Core Enables Ausgrid to Eliminate Oracle Java Audit Risk and Cut License Costs by 80%
content.summary: SUNNYVALE, Calif., December 02, 2025--Azul, the only company 100% focused on Java, today announced that Ausgrid, Australia’s largest electricity distributor, has eliminated Oracle Java audit exposure and reduced potential Java licensing costs by 80% after migrating to Azul Platform Core. The migration, completed in just two months, also reduced Java-related vulnerabilities by 99% across Ausgrid’s IT environment.
